de.affect.manage

Class AffectManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.affect.manage.AppraisalManager
      • de.affect.manage.AffectManager

  • public class AffectManager
extends AppraisalManager
    The class AffectManager stores all necessary data for the affect computation of virtual characters. This code relys on the xml bean classes created with xmlbeans v1.3 from the Affect.xsd schema, which is part of this distribution.
    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    Patrick Gebhard

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AffectManager.InterfaceHolder
      InterfaceHolder class provides methods for accessing some data stored/handled by an AffectManager.

      • getCharacterByName

        public CharacterManager getCharacterByName(java.lang.String name)
                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        getCharacterByName returns a CharacterManger object related to a given name of a character. If no character with this name exists, null will be returned.
        Parameters:
        name - a string contains a name of a character
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getGroupByName

        public GroupManager getGroupByName(java.lang.String name)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        getGroupByName returns a GroupManager object related to a given name of a group. If no group with this name exists, null will be returned.
        Parameters:
        name - a string contains a name of a group
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Returns:
        CharacterManager[] contains of all characters

      • getGroups

        public GroupManager[] getGroups()
        getGroups returns GroupManager array contains of all groups.
        Returns:
        GroupManager[] contains of all characters

      • removeCharacter

        public void removeCharacter(java.lang.String name)
        Remove a character. If the character does not exist, the function will not produce an error message.
        Parameters:
        name - Character to remove.

        Parameters:
        name - Group to remove.

      • pauseAffectComputation

        public boolean pauseAffectComputation()
        Pauses the real-time affect computation (emotion decay and mood computation) Returns false if at least one character's affect computation cannot be paused
        Returns:
        false if at least one character's affect computation cannot be paused, true otherwise

      • resumeAffectComputation

        public boolean resumeAffectComputation()
        Resume a paused real-time affect computation (emotion decay and mood computation) Returns false if at least one character's affect computation cannot be continued
        Returns:
        false if at least one character's affect computation cannot be continued, true otherwise

      • stepwiseAffectComputation

        Perfoms a single step in affect computation (emotion decay and mood computation) Returns false if at least one character's affect computation cannot be continued
        Returns:
        false if at least one character's affect computation cannot be continued, true otherwise

        Returns:
        affect snapshot of all characters

      • getCurrentAffectEmotionml

        public emotionml.EmotionmlDocument getCurrentAffectEmotionml(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the current affect snapshot of all characters and Groups
        Parameters:
        name - the name of a character
        Returns:
        affect snapshot of the specified character in EmotionML format

      • processSignal

        public AffectOutputDocument processSignal(AffectInputDocument.AffectInput ai)
        The method processSignal processes the signal values, that are potentially stored in the AffectInput Java object. According to the type of signal, it will be than further processed by an suitable function.
        Parameters:
        ai - a Java object related to an AffectInput-Element defined by the Affect.xsd

      • stopAll

        public void stopAll()
        Stops all affect processing task in each CharacterManager object and AffectManager object.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method for the AffectManager
